newsitem.title: CHILE: Chilean blue chips drift lower, end down.
newsitem.headline: Chilean blue chips drift lower, end down.

text.p: Chilean blue chip stocks eased in quiet afternoon trade to end modestly off as investors moved into lower-profile issues from the usual IPSA stars in the electrical and telecom sectors.
The blue-chip IPSA index ended 0.14 percent lower at 132.90 points, while the general IGPA index was 0.07 percent higher at 5760.31 points on moderate volume of 130 million shares.
Turning from power and telecom heavyweights, investors dipped modestly into stocks linked with the copper, steel and wood pulp industries, said traders.
The market was dragged down by a fall in power generator Chilgener, which dropped on rumors its largest shareholder, Copec, was planning to sell stock, said dealers.
Copec owns 10 percent of Chilgener, Chile's second largest power generator.
Other losers included power distributor Chilectra, which shed 0.49 percent to 3,055 pesos.
Winners included Copec, up 0.75 percent to 2,010 pesos and power utility Chilquinta, which rose 2.3 percent to 2,220 pesos.
